IRS990.MissionDescription: Our new century needs and will be shaped by extraordinary individuals. Meeting the challenges and opportunities of an interdependent world will require versatile intellectual competence and uncompromising commitment. Those who thrive in and contribute to this world will have a solid sense of who they are, and respect for who others are, as individuals, as members of a group, as citizens of their nation, and as members of a global community. They will have a rigorous academic preparation and a passion to become the best they can be and to help others achieve their best. The mission of Atlanta International School is to develop such individuals.
IRS990.Description: Atlanta International School was founded 25 years ago by a group of parents, international educators and members of the business community whose aim was to provide the Atlanta area with the kind of international educational opportunities found in major cities throughout the world. Support from major corporations and public figures was obtained because of the school's importance in the development of Atlanta as the premier international city in the southeastern United States. The school opened in September 1985 with 51 students, pre-kindergarten through first grade, in three language tracks: English plus French, German or Spanish. Mandarin instruction is also available in the Upper School. AIS moved to its current home, a 1920's era building on the National Register of Historic Places, in the Buckhead area of Atlanta in 1995. Enrollment stands at nearly 1,000 students in grades 4K 12; 98 countries around the world are represented in our school community of students, faculty, staff and parents. AIS is one of only a handful of schools in the United States authorized to offer International Baccalaureate programs for Primary, Middle School and Upper School students. Primary students follow a bilingual curriculum until the end of fifth grade. AIS offers 86 different IB Diploma Programme courses (grades 11-12) and 160 middle years IB courses. Of the 76 graduates of the class of 2010, 35% earned a bilingual IB diploma; graduates enrolled at 53 different universities around the U.S. and the world. The average IB diploma score was 32 versus a worldwide average of 29. By delivering a rigorous academic program combined with world-class standards in language acquisition within an open-minded, intercultural environment, AIS prepares students to succeed in a globally connected world. AIS is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS), the Council of International Schools (CIS), and the International Baccalaureate.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TO PRODUCE INCOME FOR FUNDING OF FUTURE OPERATING SHORTFALLS AND CAPITAL PROJECTS AS RESTRICTED BY THE ORIGINAL DONOR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is sent to all of the board members who individually review the return prior to the Form 990 being filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually each board member must complete a written conflict of interest questionnaire.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD SETS THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEADMASTER (CEO). THE HEADMASTER SETS THE COMPENSATION OF ALL UPPER LEVEL MANAGEMENT, SUBJECT TO PARAMETERS SET BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THESE PROCESSES USE BUDGETARY INFORMATION AS WELL AS INDUSTRY STANDARDS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION LEVELS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
THE SCHOOL'S FINANCE COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS WELL AS CHOOSING THE INDEPENDENT AUDITORS. THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
